title: Exchange Operator Wants Oil Prices to Reflect Emissions Performance
sub_head: New service allows for trading to take account of the carbon footprint of each barrel
body:
Energy companies can now share traceable information about the emissions that were generated when their oil was produced thanks to a new platform provided by exchange operator Xpansiv, which is betting that corporate climate targets will stoke demand for fuel with a smaller carbon footprint.
Scandinavian oil producer Lundin Energy AB said Wednesday it would be the first company to use Xpansivâ€™s platform to record emissions data for its crude.
